(0	Template:Fbu-rt/doc	{{documentation subpage}}==Description==<tt><nowiki>{{fbu|age|nation|variant|size=optional|name=optional}}</nowiki></tt>Produces a flag icon attached to a wikilinked national under-''NN'' (e.g. under-20, under-21, etc.) football team article. Similar to [[Template:Fbu]], but puts the flag icon on the right side of the team name instead of to the left. This is useful when formatting match results.;Parameters*''nation'' — Use either the name of the nation or the three-letter country code as used by [[List of FIFA country codes|FIFA]]*''age'' — Specifies the age limit (e.g. "20", "21", etc.)*''variant'' (optional) — Specifies an alternate (historical) flag to use.  This parameter is documented by the appropriate template in [[:Category:Country data templates]].*''size'' (optional) — Can be used to change the flag icon size (use sparingly!)*''name'' (optional) — Can be used to change the wikilink display text==Examples==*<tt><nowiki>{{fbu-rt|21|Netherlands}}</nowiki></tt> → {{fbu-rt|21|Netherlands}}*<tt><nowiki>{{fbu-rt|20|Brazil}}</nowiki></tt> → {{fbu-rt|20|Brazil}}*<tt><nowiki>{{fbu-rt|21|ENG}}</nowiki></tt> → {{fbu-rt|21|ENG}}*<tt><nowiki>{{fbu-rt|20|COL}}</nowiki></tt> → {{fbu-rt|20|COL}}*<tt><nowiki>{{fbu-rt|21|Romania|1965}}</nowiki></tt> → {{fbu-rt|21|Romania|1965}}==See also==*[[Template:Fbu]] — for rendering the flag on the left*[[:Category:European national under-21 association football teams]]<includeonly>[[Category:Association football flag templates]][[Category:Flag template system]]</includeonly>)
(0	Madhesi Jana Adhikar Forum, Nepal	{{Redirect|MJF|the airport in Norway with IATA code MJF|Mosjøen Airport, Kjærstad|the actor with those initials|Michael J. Fox}}{{Infobox political party|country = Nepal|name = Federal socialist Forum, Nepal|native_name = मधेसी जन अधिकार फोरम, नेपाल|colorcode = #013068|logo = [[File:Flag Forum.jpg|150px]]|president = [[Upendra Yadav]]|foundation = 2006|dissolution = 2015{{cn|date=December 2017}}|headquarters = [[Kathmandu]], [[Nepal]]|ideology = [[Social democracy]]<ref>[http://www.mjfn.org/ The MJF states social democracy as its guiding principle]</ref><br/>[[Teraibasi]] People's [[Minority rights|Rights]]<br/>[[Madhesh]] [[autonomy]] and [[Self-determination]]<br>[[Federalism]]|position = [[Centre-left]]|international =|students =|youth =|symbol = <!-- [[Image:Federal socialist Forum, Nepal-electionsymbol2072.jpg]] -->|seats1_title  = [[Constituent Assembly of Nepal|Constituent Assembly]]|seats1 = {{Composition bar|15|601|hex=#013068}}|website           = [http://www.mprfn.org/ www.mprfn.org]}}'''Madhesi Jana Adhikar Forum, Nepal''' "Madhesi People's Rights Forum, Nepal" is a [[political party]] in [[Nepal]]. It was initially not a political party as such, but a political advocacy movement demanding ethnic [[self determination]] rights with the formation of a [[Madhes]] autonomous region for [[Teraibasi]] people, an election system based on [[proportional representation]], and the setting-up of a federal republic in Nepal.<ref>{{cite web |title=MJF dismisses addition of constituencies |url=http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr13/news03.php |publisher=Nepalnews.com |date=2007-04-13 |accessdate=2008-09-06}}</ref> MJF includes former leaders of other political parties, like [[Nepali Congress]] and [[CPN(UML)]].<ref name="other">{{cite web |title=MJF is now a political party |url=http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr26/news12.php |publisher=Nepalnews.com |date=2007-04-26 |accessdate=2008-09-06}}</ref> The party is registered with the [[Election Commission of Nepal]] ahead of the [[Nepalese Constituent Assembly election, 2008|2008 Constituent Assembly election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.election.gov.np/EN/legal/list.php |title=List of Parties |publisher=Election Commission of Nepal |accessdate=2008-09-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080917023218/http://www.election.gov.np/EN/legal/list.php |archivedate=2008-09-17 |df= }}</ref>==Spring 2007 agitation==MJF declared a 'Madhes [[bandh]]' (general strike) on January 16, 2007, demanding amendments in the interim constitution in favor of a federal system and a new [[boundary delimitation|delimitation of electoral constituencies]].<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan29/news10.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan16/news03.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080820050547/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan16/news03.php |date=2008-08-20 }}</ref> 14 MJF cadres, including Upendra Yadav and MP Amresh Kumar Singh, were arrested in [[Kathmandu]] after having burnt copies of the interim constitution.<ref name="burn">[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan19/news15.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070527005007/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan19/news15.php |date=2007-05-27 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan16/news11.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070209103328/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan16/news11.php |date=2007-02-09 }}</ref> On January 18, MJF announced a ''chakkajam'' (vehicular strike) in [[Janakpur]], in protest of arrests of activists of the organisation.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan18/news07.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070216235102/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan18/news07.php |date=2007-02-16 }}</ref>On January 19, 2007, [[CPN(M)|Maoists]] opened fire in a MJF rally in [[Lahan]], Siraha district. The clashes had begun as Maoists vehicles were stopped by MJF activists enforcing a ''chakkajam''. One MJF sympathiser, 16-year-old Ramesh Mahato, was killed in the incident. The killing caused an uproar on behalf of MJF, and the situation in the region became yet more intense.<ref name="burn"/><ref name="madh">[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan28/news12.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081006203335/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan28/news12.php |date=2008-10-06 }}</ref><ref name="gaur">[http://www.nepalnews.com.np/contents/2007/englishweekly/spotlight/mar/mar30/national.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Connumications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Ensuing violence in Siraha district left several dead in the following days.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan24/news06.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On January 24, 2007, MJF issued a call for bandh in the Biratnagar, Udaypur and Saptari districts.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan24/news10.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan25/news06.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201113412/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan25/news06.php |date=2008-12-01 }}</ref> On February 6, 2007, MJF cadres abducted the CPN(M) MP [[Chinak Kurmi]] and other Maoist cadres in Bhairawa. They were released after five hours.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb06/news13.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070401081000/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb06/news13.php |date=2007-04-01 }}</ref>On January 25, 2007 MJF and [[Nepal Sadbhavana Party|NSP]] activists vandalised the ancestral home of [[Madhav Kumar Nepal]] in [[Gaur, Nepal|Gaur]].<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan26/news13.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On January 26, 2007, police opened fire on MJF protestors in [[Kalaiya]], killing Asraf Ali Ansari, 22 years old, and injuring six others.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jan/jan27/news08.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> The following day MJF held early morning rallies in Siraha, Saptari, Sarlahi, Sunsari, Mahottari and Rautahat districts. In Malangawa, government offices were padlocked by MJF activists and signs saying 'Nepal Government' were changed to 'Madhesh Government'.<ref name="madh"/>On February 7, 2007, a government committee led by Agriculture Minister [[Mahantha Thakur]] sent an invitation to talks to MJF.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb07/news01.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070209174832/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb07/news01.php |date=2007-02-09 }}</ref> On February 8, 2007, MJF suspended its strikes for a 10-day period. MJF declared three demands for enterings into talks with the government; removal of Home Minister [[Krishna Prasad Sitaula]], probing into the Lahan killing and forming a high-level committee to look into atrocities during the agitations.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb11/news04.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090108042742/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb11/news04.php |date=2009-01-08 }}</ref> On February 19, 2007, MJF gave a call for new protests, strikes and chakkajams.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb19/news12.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070223013748/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb19/news12.php |date=2007-02-23 }}</ref> On February 21, 2007, 15 persons were injured in confrontations between Maoists and MJF in [[Bhairahawa]].<ref name="gaur"/>On February 22, 2007 the government sent a second invitation for talks to the MJF.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb22/news12.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201102415/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb22/news12.php |date=2008-12-01 }}</ref> The MJF did however, not accept the invitation.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb24/news03.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070301025219/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb24/news03.php |date=2007-03-01 }}</ref>On February 23, 2007, around 150 activists from the Maoist-led [[Madhesi Rastriya Mukti Morcha]] attacked a MJF meeting in Bhairahawa.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb23/news09.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070301025328/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb23/news09.php |date=2007-03-01 }}</ref> The following day, clashes erupted between Maoists and MJF in [[Rupandehi]] and Nepalgunj.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb24/news08.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070226104421/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb24/news08.php |date=2007-02-26 }}</ref> On February 27, 2007, a 14-year-old schoolboy was killed during a MJF-Maoist clash in Puraina, Banke district.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb28/news02.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070302135630/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/feb/feb28/news02.php |date=2007-03-02 }}</ref>On March 5, 2007, MJF activists detained 18 Maoists, including a CPN(M) MP in [[Nawalparasi]]. On March 6, 2007, MJF resumed its protest programme.<ref name="prot">[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar12/news10.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080708230732/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar12/news10.php |date=2008-07-08 }}</ref> The reassumption of the strike had been postponed for three days, due to the [[Holi]] festival.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar02/news08.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201101926/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar02/news08.php |date=2008-12-01 }}</ref> As ofMarch 7 2007, the Sunsari, Sarlahi, Mahotttari, Dhanusha, Siraha, Bara, Parsa, Rautahat, Nawalparasi, Kapilvastu, Banke and Bardiya districts were affected by the MJF strike.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar07/news07.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090108051353/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar07/news07.php |date=2009-01-08 }}</ref> On March 9, 2007 clashes between MJF and Maoists erupted in [[Nepalgunj]].<ref name="gaur"/>On March 12, 2007, MJF announced a suspension of its indefinite strike call.<ref name="prot"/>On. March 16, 2007 there were MJF cadres attacked an Eight Party Alliance (i.e. [[Seven Party Alliance]] and CPN(M)) rally in [[Birgunj]]. MJF also vandalised the [[Parsa district]] office of the Nepali Congress. In the afternoon, clashes took place between police and MJF activists in various parts of the city.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar17/news06.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070320142221/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar17/news06.php |date=2007-03-20 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar17/news02.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>==Gaur carnage==On March 21, 2007, clashes erupted in [[Gaur, Nepal|Gaur]], as MJF and the [[Madhesi Rastriya Mukti Morcha]] organised simultaneous rallies. Yadav was supposed to have addressed the MJF rally. Later, 12 bodies were found at the clash site. 15 more bodies were found in Hajmaniya and Mudhbaliya, about 5 kilometers outside of Gaur. According to ''[[The Economist]]'', MJF activists had raped, burnt and speared the bodies of the victims.<ref name="gaur"/><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.economist.com/world/asia/displaystory.cfm?story_id=8929488 | work=The Economist | title=Broken peaces | date=March 29, 2007}}</ref> The majority of the killed were CPN(M) activists.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar22/news23.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080705202529/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar22/news23.php |date=2008-07-05 }}</ref>In response to the Gaur carnage, CPN(M) chairman [[Prachanda]] compared MJF with the [[Contras]] of [[Nicaragua]], charging that MJF was used by [[imperialism|imperialists]] to derail the process in Nepal. CPN(M) drafted a resolution, unanimously passed in the [[interim legislature of Nepal|interim parliament]], condemning the killings and ordering the arrest of the perpetrators. Local administrations began to prohibit the MJF to hold public rallies.<ref name="gaur"/>In April 2007, the Human Rights Treaty Monitoring Committee presented a study on the Gaur incident, and concluded that MJF had committedgross violations of human rights, like torturing people to death and raping 3 women.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr03/news17.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>A MJF spokesperson, Sitanandan Raya, claimed that the Maoists had been the attackers in Gaur, and that MJF had only retaliated.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar22/news22.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On April 11, 2007, MJF formed a three-member panel of its own to look into the Gaur killings, consisting of former Supreme Court Justice Balram Singh Kunwar, Surendra Mishra and Lal Babu Yadav.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr11/news08.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> The findings of the panel stated that MJF had been attacked by MRMM, and that violence had been committed by other Madhesi outfits, leaving MJF without blame.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/may/may28/news04.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>On March 28, 2007, there were clashes between Maoists and MJF in Barewa, Rupandehi district. According to media reports, firearms and bombs were used in the fights and three persons were injured.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar30/news04.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080706005116/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/mar/mar30/news04.php |date=2008-07-06 }}</ref>On the evening of April 4, 2007, MJF and Maoist activist opened fire at each other in Ramgunj Belgachhiya, Sunsari district.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr06/news01.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>==Talks with the government==In April 2007, a new government talks team was formed, led by Peace and Reconstruction Minister [[Ram Chandra Poudel]] and an invitation to talks was sent to MJF.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr15/news12.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> MJF put forth two conditions for entering into talks; suspension of delimitation of election constituencies and guarantees for security in the Madhes region.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr14/news10.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Upendra Yadav also stated that MJF demanded withdrawal of legal cases against MJF activists, an inquiry into killings during the Madhesi agitations and recognition of those killed as martyrs.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr19/news08.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/may/may16/news04.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201110333/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/may/may16/news04.php |date=2008-12-01 }}</ref>MJF organised a Madhes bandh April 20-April 22, 2007, leading to the cancellation of Nepali Congress rally in Janakpur, where the [[Prime Minister of Nepal|PM]] [[G.P. Koirala]] was supposed to speak.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr20/news05.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> The strike disrupted transports in Morang, Sunsari, Bara, Parsa, Siraha, Sarhali, Saptari, Dhanusha, Rautahat and Mahottari districts. Biratnagar, Inaruwa, Birgunj, Rajbiraj, Lahan, Kalaiya and Gaur were the towns most affected by the strike.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr21/news08.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080708214001/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr21/news08.php |date=2008-07-08 }}</ref>On April 25, 2007, MJF presented a four-member team for talks with the government, consisting of Upendra Yadav, Sitanandan Raya, Kishor Kumar Bishwas Tharu and Mohammad Nasir Siddiqui.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/apr/apr25/news15.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>On April 26, 2007, MJF registered itself as a political party with the [[Election Commission of Nepal]].<ref name="other"/>In May 2007, MJF put forward "three preconditions before holding talks with the government - formation of high level judicial commission to probe atrocities during Madhesi agitation, stopping government-supported attack against MJF cadres and resignation of Nepal Home Minister Krsihna Prasad Sitaula."<!-- <ref>http://www.andhranews.net/Intl/2007/May/1/Nepal-ethnic.asp</ref> -->On May 9, 2007, Yadav and Poudel met for informal talks in Birgunj.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/may/may10/news01.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/may/may15/news19.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> MJF were however, not ready for talks at the May 18 deadline. After a judicial probe commission had been instituted by the government to look into abuses during the agitations, Yadav stated on May 26, 2007, that MJF was ready for talks if cases were dropped against MJF activists and guarantees for their security was given.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/may/may26/news12.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070528075618/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/may/may26/news12.php |date=2007-05-28 }}</ref>The talks between the Government of Nepal, whose team was headed by Poudel, and the MJF talk team began in Janakpur on June 1, 2007.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun01/news03.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081007051006/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun01/news03.php |date=2008-10-07 }}</ref> MJF presented a list of 26 demands, restructuring of state, formation of commission to implement state restructuring, inclusion of Madhesis in all organs of state, federal system of governance, proportional representation, withdrawal of charges against leaders of MJF and compensation to those injured during Madhes agitation.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun01/news12.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081014032006/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun01/news12.php |date=2008-10-14 }}</ref> During the first session of talks, agreement was reached on half of the MJF demands. The government side accepted MJF demands for forming a State Reconstruction Commission, giving martyr status for the people who had died during the agitations and compensations to their families.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun02/news02.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>A second round of talks were held on July 25, 2007, in [[Dhulikhel]]. The talks ended inconclusively. According to Bishwas, the government had not fulfilled their obligations since the first round of talks.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jul/jul25/news11.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080828051656/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jul/jul25/news11.php |date=2008-08-28 }}</ref> The talks resumed at the Godavari Resort Village in [[Patan, Lalitpur|Lalitpur]] on July 28, 2007, after the government had asked for a 2-day break to do its 'homework'. After the conclusion of the session, Bishwas stated that there had not been any real progress on key issues like federalism, autonomy and election system.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jul/jul28/news08.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081007113510/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jul/jul28/news08.php |date=2008-10-07 }}</ref>The fourth round of talks was held on August 5, 2007, at Park Resort Village, Budhanilkantha. The session ended inconclusively, as MJF disagreed with the restructuring of the talks team of the government side. The proposal was that the government team would also include [[Dev Gurung]] (CPN(M)), [[Prakash Sharan Mahat]] ([[Nepali Congress (Democratic)]], former Minister of Foreign Affairs) and [[Jhala Nath Khanal]] (CPN(UML)). MJF rejected the inclusion of a Maoist member in the government team.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug05/news05.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug05/news05.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref>Upendra Yadav met with PM G.P. Koirala on August 19, 2007. Yadav stated that the PM had been positive towards discussion of the demands of MJF.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug19/news14.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug19/news14.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref> Talks resumed on August 20, 2007 and carried on for two days.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug21/news03.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug21/news03.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref> MJF did however leave the talks, saying that the government was not seriously considering their demands.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug22/news09.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug21/news11.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug21/news11.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref> MJF then issued a warning for new agitations, and stated August 31, 2007 as the deadline for their demands to be met before they would call for a new revolt.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug23/news10.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug23/news10.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug24/news06.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>On August 30, 2007, MJF agreed to a 22-point deal with the government, which included a mixed election system, martyr status for those killed during the agitations and declaration of [[Muslim holidays|Muslim festivals]] as public holidays.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug30/news11.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> CPN(M) chair Prachanda rapidly denounced the deal as a 'conspiracy'.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/aug/aug31/news13.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>In early September 2007, MJF formed a Central Election Board to lead the election campaign of the party, headed by Sitanandan Raya.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/sep/sep06/news20.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081007045842/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/sep/sep06/news20.php |date=2008-10-07 }}</ref>==Post-settlement situation==On June 13, 2007, MJF activists killed a regional [[Young Communist League, Nepal|Young Communist League]] leader in Lumbini.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun13/news11.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201105919/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun13/news11.php |date=2008-12-01 }}</ref>The MJF Central Committee held a meeting June 17-June 18, 2007. The meeting decided to dissolve the Central Committee, and form an ad hoc-committee to lead the party until the holding of a conference.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun18/news13.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201091155/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun18/news13.php |date=2008-12-01 }}</ref>On June 22, 2007, MJF organised a bandh, protesting the abduction of its youth leader in Koteshwore, Jitendra Shah, by the YCL. The strike disrupted business activities and schools in Rautahat, Bara, Parsa, Siraha, Sunsari, Dhanusha, Saptari, Sarlahi and Mahottari districts. MJF had called on the government to ban YCL a few days earlier.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jun/jun22/news05.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>On June 30, 2007, Kishore Kumar Bishwas stated that MJF would sabotage the holding of Constituent Assembly election, if their demand for proportional representation was not met.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jul/jul01/news01.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090108074445/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jul/jul01/news01.php |date=2009-01-08 }}</ref>In the summer of 2007, MJF formed a youth wing, [[Madhesi Youth Forum]]. According to a report in the daily newspaper ''[[Nepal Samacharpatra]]'', MJF intended to provide combat training to the cadres of MYF. ''Nepal Samacharpatra'' stated that the motivation behind the formation of MYF had been countering the influence of YCL.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/jul/jul08/news01.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>==Split==A split occurred in MJF in September 2007, as the MJF vice chairmen Bhagyanath Gupta and Kishor Kumar Bishwash and Ram Kumar Sharma and Jitendra Sonal were expelled from MJF. They had opposed the 22-point deal with the government, demanding fully proportional election system and declaration of republic before the election. They had also disagreed with Yadav's recognition of [[Nepali language|Nepali]] as the national language through the 22-point deal, and demanded that both Nepali and [[Hindi]] be declared national languages. The expellees then formed a party of their own, [[Madhesi Janadhikar Forum Madhesh]].<ref>[http://www.kantipuronline.com/kolnews.php?nid=121770 eKantipur.com - Nepal's No.1 News Portal<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071113205536/http://kantipuronline.com/kolnews.php?nid=121770 |date=2007-11-13 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.kathmandupost.com/kolnews.php?&nid=132604 eKantipur.com - Nepal's No.1 News Portal<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080430081613/http://www.kathmandupost.com/kolnews.php |date=2008-04-30 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalmountainnews.com/news.php/2008/02/29/govt-frnf-talks-afoot.html Govt-FRNF talks afoot « Nepal Travel and Tourism news, Nepal news, news of Nepal, Nepal Mountain, Political, Expedition,Business,Sports and Everest news<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/sep/sep03/news02.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>==Reviving protest movement and negotiations==On October 6, 2007, MJF stated that the government had failed to fulfill its parts of the 22-point agreement and was failing to safeguard communal harmony. MJF called for the formation of a neutral 'election government' ahead of the polls. The party announced a withdrawal from the election campaign and initiation of a new wave of protests on November 22, 2007.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/oct/oct06/news16.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/oct/oct06/news16.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref>Prime Minister Koirala met with Yadav on November 16, 2007, and promised to fulfill the demands raised by MJF, thus cancelling the new wave of protest programmes scheduled for November 22.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/nov/nov16/news04.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/nov/nov16/news04.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref> On November 17, 2007, Yadav called for the resignation of the Prime Minister.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/nov/nov18/news06.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>MJF and the [[Rajendra Mahato]]-led [[Sadbhavana Party|Nepal Sadbhavana Party]] formed the United Madhesi Front, with a 9-point programme. The front called for the creation of a Madhes autonomous state.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/dec/dec17/news09.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201111656/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2007/dec/dec17/news09.php |date=2008-12-01 }}</ref> On January 19, 2008 the Front announced a protest movement starting January 23. On January 20, 2008, the [[Tarai-Madhesh Loktantrik Party]] sided with the call for mass protests.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/jan/jan20/news14.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> A strike that began on January 23, 2008, had its greatest impact in Janakpur.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/jan/jan27/news06.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/jan/jan27/news06.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref>On February 3, 2008, UMF stepped up its protests, calling for a shut-down strike across several districts. On the second day of the shutdown, MJF activists clashed with police in Nawalparasi.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/feb/feb04/news11.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/feb/feb04/news11.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref>MJF, SP and TMLP formed a new front on February 9, 2008, the [[United Democratic Madhesi Front]]. UDMF put forth six demands, including formation of a Madhesi autonomous state, right to self-determination, proportional representation of Madhesis, Janajatis and [[Dalit]]s and recruitments of Madhesis to [[Nepal Army]]. UDMF announced protests on February 11–12, and an indefinite strike starting February 13.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/feb/feb09/news04.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/feb/feb09/news04.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref> On February 16, 2008, police open fire on protestors in Jitpur, Bara district.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/feb/feb16/news04.php Nepalnews.com Mercantile Communications Pvt. Ltd<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> The strike was to last for 16 days, causing shortages of goods in the Kathmandu valley. The strike ended with a deal between government and UDMF, providing for a federal state structure with an autonomous Madhesi state, proportional recruitment of marginalised communities into Nepal Army, martyrhood status to be declared for the killed in the Madhesi movement agitations and free medical treatment for the injured. A special provision was also made so that the UDMF parties could file candidates for the Constituent Assembly election (the ordinary deadline had already passed).<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/feb/feb28/news08.php Nepalnews.com, news from Nepal as it happens<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081012212139/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/feb/feb28/news08.php |date=2008-10-12 }}</ref>==Election campaign==On March 3, 2008, MJF submitted a list of 101 candidates for the [[proportional representation]] election.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/mar/mar02/news16.php Nepalnews.com, news from Nepal as it happens<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20070617171706/http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/mar/mar02/news16.php |date=2007-06-17 }}</ref> The party also nominated 105 candidates for the [[First Past the Post]] seats. The party did however fail to meet the requirement of nominating 33% women. In the FPTP seats, only three MJF candidates were women.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/mar/mar11/news09.php Nepalnews.com, news from Nepal as it happens<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On March 16, 2008, MJF released its election manifesto. The manifesto proposed making Nepal a federal, [[secularism|secular]] republic with an executive President. The parliament would have two chambers, the upper chamber would be an 'Assembly of Ethnicities'. According to the manifesto, regions of Nepal should have the [[right to self-determination]] and the formation of a single Madhesh province. The manifesto also demanded increased recruitment of Madhesi youths into the army.<ref>[http://www.nepalnews.com/archive/2008/mar/mar16/news08.php Nepalnews.com, news from Nepal as it happens<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>==Views by NGOs==In a report, INSEC (which had participated in the previous probe on the Gaur killings) accused the MJF of 33 killings and 7 adductions in the period of November 2006-November 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.inseconline.org/report/Human%20Rights%20Situation%20in%20Nepal%20after%20Loktantra.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-04-18 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080509064455/http://www.inseconline.org/report/Human%20Rights%20Situation%20in%20Nepal%20after%20Loktantra.pdf |archivedate=2008-05-09 |df= }}</ref> [[Reporters Without Borders]] stated in a report dated June 2007 that MJF was 'the most aggressive group towards journalists'.<ref>[http://www.rsf.org/article.php3?id_article=22448 Reporters sans frontières - Nepal<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071030163010/http://www.rsf.org/article.php3?id_article=22448 |date=2007-10-30 }}</ref>==Muslim faction==MJF has an organised Muslim faction. The general secretary of the faction is Mohammad Nasir Siddhique.<ref>[http://www.kantipuronline.com/kolnews.php?nid=142596 eKantipur.com - Nepal's No.1 News Portal<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080401234045/http://www.kantipuronline.com/kolnews.php?nid=142596 |date=2008-04-01 }}</ref>==References=={{Reflist|30em}}{{Political parties in Nepal}}[[Category:Political parties in Nepal]])

(0	File:'Flora', oil on linen painting by Raymond Han, 2003, private collection.jpg	'Flora', oil on linen painting by [[Raymond Han]], 2003, private collection=== Fair use in [[Raymond Han]] ===Though this image is subject to copyright, its use is covered by the U.S. fair use laws because:# This is a historically significant work that could not be conveyed in words.# Inclusion is for information, education, and analysis only.# Its inclusion in the article(s) adds significantly to the article(s) because it shows a major type of work produced by the artist.# The image is a low resolution copy of the original work and would be unlikely to impact sales of prints or be usable as a desktop backdrop.# It is not replaceable with an uncopyrighted or freely copyrighted image of comparable educational value.<!--BetacommandBot Exclude-->   <!--SieBot Exclude-->   <!--STBotI Exclude-->{{Non-free 2D art|image has rationale=yes}})
(0	Urban Diversion	'''Urban Diversion''' is a [[San Francisco Bay Area]] activities and adventures social club. <ref name="bnet">[http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4176/is_20040820/ai_n14584376/pg_2?tag=artBody;col1 Urban Diversion Emphasizes Pals and Good Times], Bnet Aug 2004</ref> Established in 2003, the company reportedly serves over 700 members and hosts and organizes 35-50 unique events each month in [[San Francisco, California|San Francisco]], the [[East Bay (San Francisco Bay Area)|East Bay]], and the [[South Bay (San Francisco Bay Area)|South Bay]]. <ref name="netvibe">[http://www.nitevibe.com/buzz/nitevibe_buzz115.htm Urban Diversion 1 Year Launch Party], Netvibe 2004</ref> Urban Diversion is an outlet for professionals in their 20s, 30s, and 40s to meet new people and try an eclectic range of activities.== History ==Urban Diversion is the brainchild of ex dot-com veterans Topher Thiessen and Lance Evander.  They had a dream to turn a lifestyle of leisure and recreation into a business, where the priorities are having fun, experiencing adventures, and making new friends.  Their main mission was to give young professionals an affordable way to enhance their social lives and free time. <ref name="sfgate">[http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/chronicle/archive/2004/07/30/EBG897S6O71.DTL Urban Activity clubs provide a place to grow, explore, and meet], Sfgate.com</ref>The company features a members-only Clubhouse in San Francisco’s [[North Beach, San Francisco, California|Fisherman's Wharf]] neighborhood, and two ski cabins on [[Lake Tahoe]].  Urban Diversion offers a wide variety of events ranging from hiking, kayaking, and camping weekends, to signature events like their Limo Scavenger Hunts and annual Pirate Ship Party. <ref name="pirate">[http://www.mmdnewswire.com/urbn-diversi-ud-hosts-fifth-annul-pirte-ship-prty-2393-2.html Fifth Annual Pirate Ship Party], Oct 2007</ref>  The Clubhouse boasts a Tiki-themed full bar, an entertainment room complete with in-house theater, TiVo, and full stereo system, and a main socializing and events room furnished with plush couches and a wide open window view.  They also plan group international vacations to destinations such as Thailand, Costa Rica, Africa, and Europe.== References =={{Reflist}}== External links==* [http://www.urbandiversion.com Urban Diversion Website][[Category:Organizations based in the San Francisco Bay Area]])
(0	Yucatán box turtle	{{subspeciesbox| image = Terrapene carolina yucatana.jpg| status =| status_system =| status_ref =| genus = Terrapene| species = carolina| species_link = Common box turtle| subspecies = yucatana| authority = ([[George Albert Boulenger|Boulenger]], 1895)<ref>{{cite journal | url = http://www.iucn-tftsg.org/wp-content/uploads/file/Accounts/crm_5_000_checklist_v3_2010.pdf | title = Turtles of the world, 2010 update: Annotated checklist of taxonomy, synonymy, distribution and conservation status |journal=Chelonian Research Monographs|volume=5| accessdate =|date=2010-12-14 |author1=Rhodin, Anders G.J. |author2=van Dijk, Peter Paul |author3=Inverson, John B. |author4=Shaffer, H. Bradley |page=000.107| archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/5uzfktoIh | archivedate = 2010-12-15 | doi=10.3854/crm.5.000.checklist.v3.2010}}</ref><!--| synonyms = ''Cistudo yucatana'' [[George Albert Boulenger|Boulenger]], 1895<br>''Terrapene yucatana'' - Siebenrock, 1909<br>''Terrapene mexicana yucatana'' - [[Hobart Muir Smith|Smith]], 1939<br>''Terrapene carolina yucatana'' - Milstead, 1967-->| synonyms =* ''Cistudo yucatana'' <small>Boulenger, 1895</small>* ''Terrapene yucatana'' <br><small>&ndash; [[Friedrich Siebenrock|Siebenrock]], 1909</small>* ''Terrapene mexicana yucatana'' <br><small>&ndash; [[Hobart Muir Smith|H.M. Smith]], 1939</small>* ''Terrapene carolina yucatana'' <br><small>&ndash; Milstead, 1967</small>* ''Terapene mexicana jucatana'' <small>Nietzke, 1973</small>  ''([[ex errore]])''| synonyms_ref=<ref name="Fritz2007">{{Cite journal | journal = Vertebrate Zoology | title = Checklist of Chelonians of the World | year = 2007 | author = Fritz, Uwe |author2=Peter Havaš  | volume = 57 | issue = 2 | pages = 199–200 | id = | url = http://www.cnah.org/pdf_files/851.pdf | archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/5v20ztMND | archivedate = 2010-12-17|accessdate = 29 May 2012 }}</ref>}}The '''Yucatán box turtle''' (''Terrapene carolina yucatana'') is a [[subspecies]] of [[box turtle]] [[Endemism|endemic]] to [[Mexico]].==Geographic range==It is found in the Mexican state of [[Yucatán (state)|Yucatán]].==Description==Its shell is light-colored with some star-shaped dark spots. Its head is also light-colored. It has four toes on each foot.==References=={{Reflist}}{{Emydidae}}{{DEFAULTSORT:Yucatan box turtle}}[[Category:Terrapene]][[Category:Reptiles of Mexico]])
(0	Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Luther Welsh	<div class="boilerplate metadata afd vfd xfd-closed" style="background-color: #F3F9FF; margin: 2em 0 0 0; padding: 0 10px 0 10px; border: 1px solid #AAAAAA;">:''The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. <span style="color:red">'''Please do not modify it.'''</span>  Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]).  No further edits should be made to this page.''<!--Template:Afd topNote:  If you are seeing this page as a result of an attempt to re-nominate an article for deletion, you must manually edit the AfD nomination links in order to create a new discussion page using the name format of [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/PAGENAME (2nd nomination)]].  When you create the new discussion page, please provide a link to this old discussion in your nomination. -->The result was    '''delete'''. [[user talk:Skomorokh|<span style="background: #222; color: #fff;"><font face="Goudy Old Style">&nbsp;Skomorokh&nbsp;</font></span>]] 01:05, 8 September 2009 (UTC)===[[Luther Welsh]]==={{ns:0|T}}:{{la|Luther Welsh}} (<span class="plainlinks">[{{fullurl:Luther Welsh|wpReason={{urlencode: [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Luther Welsh]]}}&action=delete}} delete]</span>) – <includeonly>([[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Luther Welsh|View AfD]])</includeonly><noinclude>([[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Log/2009 September 1#{{anchorencode:Luther Welsh}}|View log]])</noinclude>:({{findsources|Luther Welsh}})Non-notable according to [[WP:N]] or [[WP:PROF]]. Only accomplishment seems to be running a program to find large prime numbers and finding one. [[User:RobinK|Robin]] ([[User talk:RobinK|talk]]) 13:39, 25 August 2009 (UTC)*'''Delete''' to me neither finding one prime number nor serving on the board of GIMP is notable enough for a WP page. Google returns a few thousands counts on "Luther Welsh", but, many are not this Luther Welsh, and many are simply an echo of a few pages (wikipedia article and a few cites of it). [[User:Materialscientist|Materialscientist]] ([[User talk:Materialscientist|talk]]) 08:09, 26 August 2009 (UTC)*'''Keep''' - I think he passes notability criteria in [[WP:BIO]]. [[User:Gandalf61|Gandalf61]] ([[User talk:Gandalf61|talk]]) 13:56, 26 August 2009 (UTC)*'''Weak keep''' - one minor discovery might be [[WP:NEWS]]. [[User:Bearian&#39;sBooties|Bearian&#39;sBooties]] ([[User talk:Bearian&#39;sBooties|talk]]) 15:35, 28 August 2009 (UTC)<hr style="width:50%;" />:<span style="color:#FF4F00;">'''[[WP:RELIST|<font color=#BF3B30>Relisted</font>]] to generate a more thorough discussion so consensus may be reached.'''</span><br /><small>Please add new comments below this notice. Thanks, [[User:Ron Ritzman|Ron Ritzman]] ([[User talk:Ron Ritzman|talk]]) 00:37, 1 September 2009 (UTC)</small><!-- from Template:Relist -->{{#ifeq:{{FULLPAGENAME}}|Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Luther Welsh||}}*<small class="delsort-notice">'''Note''':  This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Academics and educators|list of Academics and educators-related deletion discussions]]. <!--Template:Delsort--></small> <small>-- [[User:Ron Ritzman|Ron Ritzman]] ([[User talk:Ron Ritzman|talk]]) 00:38, 1 September 2009 (UTC)</small>*'''Comment'''. I would have thought that the discovery of a large Mersenne prime confers notability. What do mathematicians think? [[User:Xxanthippe|Xxanthippe]] ([[User talk:Xxanthippe|talk]]) 02:27, 1 September 2009 (UTC).**'''Comment'''. If that were it, to me, it would be a clear case of [[WP:BIO1E]]. What I'm less sure of is whether his role in GIMPS is enough to elevate him about that "known only for one thing" standard. —[[User:David Eppstein|David Eppstein]] ([[User talk:David Eppstein|talk]]) 03:10, 2 September 2009 (UTC)*'''Delete''' As David Eppstein, notes, all available evidence points to the fact that Welsh is notable for <i>at most</i> one thing: the discovery of a new Mersenne prime.  As a number theorist weighing in on the value of this achievement, it is my opinion that this makes Welsh insufficiently notable for a wikipedia article.  (Moreover, what does the article say, or could it say, beyond this one fact?)  It is appropriate to list this achievement in the article [[Mersenne prime]], as it already is. [[User:Plclark|Plclark]] ([[User talk:Plclark|talk]]) 04:38, 2 September 2009 (UTC)*'''Delete'''. Not even close to [[WP:PROF]] and, as for [[WP:BIO]], we have a little press about his discovery of a Mersenne prime but almost nothing else. I searched hard for sources a week ago (before I did, the article had basically the same content but was totally unsourced) and could find almost nothing about him to add to the article. As discussed above, I think this falls under [[WP:BIO1E]]: his discovery of the prime is a notable event that is already covered under [[Mersenne prime]], his work with [[GIMPS]] does not really add notability to the article, and I've already included the only other interesting and verifiable factoid (his coinage of the GIMPS name) to the GIMPS article. —[[User:David Eppstein|David Eppstein]] ([[User talk:David Eppstein|talk]]) 16:50, 2 September 2009 (UTC)*'''Delete'''. I was thinking of suggesting a merge to [[Great Internet Mersenne Prime Search]], but the merge-worthy info is already there. His name does not seem a likely search term so I see little point in a redirect; this is the only thing he's known for, and if you're into [[Mersenne prime]]s, the link from there to [[GIMPS]] is already prominent. <small>'''Procedural Comment''': the relisting suggests [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting|WikiProject Deletion sorting]] is in need of more members, or deletion sorting needs to be encouraged or made more prominent on the [[WP:AFD]] page. If this had been listed in [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Academics and educators|WikiProject Deletion sorting/Academics and educators]] or [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Science|WikiProject Deletion sorting/Science]] initially I doubt it would have needed relisting. </small>[[User:Qwfp|Qwfp]] ([[User talk:Qwfp|talk]]) 18:42, 2 September 2009 (UTC):::::'''Question''' David E, if the one thing is of long term historic interest it passes the bar at BLP1E. So the qy is, how important is the discovery of this number?     '''[[User:DGG| DGG]]''' ([[User talk:DGG| talk ]]) 20:59, 2 September 2009 (UTC)::::::Better to ask Plclark, as he's an actual number theorist; I've only played with number theory. Nowadays the search for Mersenne primes has been automated by GIMPs to the point where I think that the notability of any individual discovery has been diminished, but his discovery was prior to that period and has more of the flavor of an individual wildcatter striking black gold. There are plenty of reliable sources about the discovery and I think it does have long-term significance. But to me, passing the bar at BIO1E is less about the size of the 1E itself and more about whether there is anything to say about the subject that is not more directly about the 1E. In this case, there doesn't seem to be much to say about Welsh other than his discovery. —[[User:David Eppstein|David Eppstein]] ([[User talk:David Eppstein|talk]]) 23:46, 2 September 2009 (UTC):''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate.  <span style="color:red">'''Please do not modify it.'''</span> Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page. <!--Template:Afd bottom--></div>)
(0	Joseph Simonelli	{{Orphan|date=September 2014}}'''Joseph Simonelli ''' is an American playwright. He first began his career as the resident [[playwright]] for First Avenue Playhouse in [[Atlantic Highlands, New Jersey|Atlantic Highlands NJ]].His most notable published works are ''Men are Dogs'', ''Ladies in Lingerie'' & ''Heaven Help Me''.Simonelli grew up in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn, New York, where his father, Phillip,  was a local orchestra leader. Joe was exposed to Broadway at an early age as his parents encouraged him and his four siblings to attend the theatre. Starting at the tender age of seven he saw such stars as Danny Kaye in "Two by Two" and Katherine Hepburn in "Coco." Simonelli appeared on stage as early as the second grade beginning with elementary school productions at St. Patrick's Grammar School until his senior year at Xaverian High School in Brooklyn when he was featured as one of the jets in "West Side Story". Forty years later he played the role of Lt. Schrank in an equity production on Staten island.Simonelli didn't seriously get into theatre until the age of forty when he tried out for a local community theatre production in New Jersey. Shortly thereafter he started writing plays and submitting them around New York City and Los Angeles.POPULAR TITLES - Although known for his popular comedies such as '''''Men are Dogs''''' and '''''Old Ringers,''''' which get performed regularly around the United States and Canada, Simonelli also writes across theatrical genres. He has written a popular musical about internet dating titled ''"'''Romance.com"''' ''and his ghost story thriller'' '''The Ghost in'' ''the Meadow"''', ''has had many professional and amateur performances, most notably an extended run at The State Theatre of Virginia, (The Barter) An old line LORT venue.''Simonelli currently produces his plays in limited run productions on Staten Island and Manhattan, New York City. He is a full member of the Dramatist Guild of America and is represented by Gary DaSilva in Los Angeles who also represents Neil Simon, the late Larry Gelbart and Mart Crowley. Joe has three children and currently resides in New York City.==References==<!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically -->{{Reflist}}==External links==* [http://joesimonelli.com/ Official Website]* http://www.doollee.com/PlaywrightsS/simonelli-joe.html* http://www.redbankgreen.com/2008/06/show-dessert-an.html* http://www.theatermania.com/new-york/shows/men-are-dogs_152787/cast/* https://web.archive.org/web/20110706215838/http://www.thedailynews.cc/main.asp?SectionID=2&SubSectionID=2&ArticleID=30008&TM=59634.7* https://web.archive.org/web/20090107020948/http://joesimonelli.com/indexcurrperf.html{{DEFAULTSORT:Simonelli, Joseph}}[[Category:Writers from Brooklyn]][[Category:Writers from New Jersey]][[Category:People from Atlantic Highlands, New Jersey]][[Category:American dramatists and playwrights]][[Category:Living people]])
(0	Open flap debridement	In [[dentistry]], '''open flap debridement''' is a [[periodontology|periodontal]] procedure in which the supporting [[alveolar bone]] and root surfaces of teeth are exposed by incising the [[gingiva]] to provide increased access for [[scaling and root planing]].  While the efficacy of this treatment is debated,<ref>{{cite news|last=Dooley|first=Mark|title= Best Teeth Treatment |url=http://arlingtontexasdentist.net/|accessdate=24 September 2013}}</ref> it is almost always performed ancillary to any [[bone|osseous]] resective or regenerative periodontal procedures.==References=={{Reflist}}{{Periodontology}}[[Category:Dentistry procedures]][[Category:Periodontology]])
