Thakhira FC was formed and has competed in the [[Qatar Football Association|QFA]]-sanctioned Qatar Amateur League since 2013.<ref name="dohastadium"/>==Education==The follows school(s) are located in Even vandals typically make silly test edits, and other users usually create userpages or take tentative first steps.Both Babyface and DarknezFlorida were created rather close together, too:*Babyface: 23:16, 30 December 2015*DarknezFlorida: 00:07, 31 December 2015In my opinion, it is either meatpuppetry or socking for Babyface + DarknezFlorida, and clear IP socking for DarknezFlorida. es/default.aspx|domain=evoqua.com|U=23|L=20|UL=>>|WUL=>>}}{{User:COIBot/OtherLinks|link=www.evoqua.com/en/products|domain=evoqua.com|U=23|L=20|UL=>>|WUL=>>}}{{User:COIBot/OtherLinks|link=www.evoqua.com/en/about/Pages/keating.aspx|domain=evoqua.com|U=23|L=20|UL=>>|WUL=>>}}}}{{User:COIBot/Additionlist_bottom}}* (0	Dockyard and Engineering Works Limited	{{Infobox company| name = Dockyard and Engineering Works Limited| logo =| logo_size =| type = [[State-owned enterprise|State-owned]]| industry = [[Shipbuilding]] <br /> [[Ship repair|Ship engineering]]| founded = {{Start date and age|1922}} <!-- if known: in [[city]], [[country]] -->| hq_location_city = [[Narayanganj]]| hq_location_country = Bangladesh| key_people = {{Unbulleted list | [[Admiral]] Mohammed Nizamuddin Ahmed ([[Chairman]]) | }}| products = [[Naval ship]]s <br /> [[Landing craft]]s <br /> [[Tanker (ship)|Tankers]] <br /> [[Patrol Boats]] <br/>[[Survey vessel]]s| owner = [[Bangladesh Navy]]| num_employees =| num_employees_year = <!-- Year of num_employees data (if known) -->| website = {{URL|dewbn.com}}}}'''Dockyard and Engineering Works (DEW) Limited''' is a ship construction and repair yard at the [[Narayanganj]], [[Bangladesh]] owned by the [[Government of Bangladesh]] under [[Ministry of Defence (Bangladesh)|Ministry of Defence]] and managed by the [[Bangladesh Navy]]. The yard built many small patrol boats for the [[Bangladesh Coast Guard]] and landing crafts for the [[Bangladesh Navy]]. Currently, it is constructing two [[Shobuj Bangla class patrol craft]] and two fast patrol boats for the Bangladesh Coast Guard.==History==The shipyard was founded in 1922. Initially, it was a profit making institution which continued after the independence of Bangladesh. But, it experienced a period of loss starting from the nineties. As a result, it was laid off in 2002. In 7 December 2007, the yard was handed over to the Bangladesh Navy. From then, it is regaining its standard. <ref>{{cite web| url=http://dewbn.com/dewl-history/|title=DEW Ltd History|publisher=DEW official website|accessdate=3 January 2017}}</ref> This shipyard has constructed the [[Pabna Class]] riverine patrol boats from 1972 to 1977, which are the first Bangladesh made warships..<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldwarships.com/class/pabna |title=Pabna Class Patrol Boat. |publisher=Worldwidwships.com |date= |accessdate=3 January 2017}}</ref>==Naval projects==*[[Pabna Class]] riverine patrol boats*[[Shobuj Bangla class patrol craft|Shobuj Bangla class]] inshore patrol vessels*Fast Patrol Boats*Harbour patrol boats*[[Landing craft tank]]*''X-12'' patrol boats==See also==*[[Khulna Shipyard]]==References=={{reflist}}[[Category:Defence companies of Bangladesh]][[Category:Shipbuilding companies of Bangladesh]][[Category:Shipyards of Bangladesh]][[Category:Shipyards of Asia]][[Category:Government-owned companies of Bangladesh]][[Category:Organisations based in Narayanganj]])
(0	Neha Chavda	'''Neha Harsukh Chavda''' (born 13 March 1993) is a [[Gujarat]]i [[Cricketer]].<ref>[https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/416/416191/416191.html Players profile]</ref> She plays for [[Saurashtra women's cricket team|Saurashtra]] and [[West Zone women's cricket team|West Zone]]. She has played 4 [[First-class matches]], 41 [[Limited overs cricket|Limited over matches]] and 36 [[Women's Twenty20 cricket|Women's Twenty20]].<ref>[https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/416/416191/Womens_two_innings_Matches.html Womens_two_innings_Matches]</ref><ref>[https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/416/416191/Womens_limited_overs_Matches.html Womens_limited_overs_Matches]</ref><ref>[https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/416/416191/Womens_Twenty20_Matches.html Womens_Twenty20_Matches]</ref>== References =={{Reflist}}{{DEFAULTSORT:Chavda, Neha}}[[Category:1993 births]][[Category:People from Gujarat]][[Category:Saurashtra women cricketers]][[Category:West Zone women cricketers]][[Category:Living people]])

(0	Jhenaidah Government Veterinary College	{{Multiple issues|{{Underlinked|date=October 2017}}{{Orphan|date=October 2017}}}}'''Jhenaidah Government Veterinary College''' (JGVC) is the 9th veterinary institution in Bangladesh. It is affiliated by [[Jessore University of Science & Technology|Jessore Science and Technology University]]. It provides a DVM ([[Doctor of Veterinary Medicine]]) degree in 5 years. It was established at 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://jgvetcollegebd.com/|title=Jhenaidah Government Veterinary College|accessdate=5 August 2017}}</ref>Dr. Liaquit Ali is the founder principle of the college.==References=={{reflist}}==Further reading==* {{cite news |title=Teacher crisis hits Jhenidah Veterinary College |url=http://www.theindependentbd.com/home/printnews/17296 |newspaper=The Independent |location=Dhaka |date=29 September 2015}}* {{cite news |title=Teacher crisis hampers education |url=http://www.thedailystar.net/country/teacher-crisis-hampers-education-157933 |newspaper=The Daily Star |date=16 October 2015}}{{coord|23.5567|89.0916|region:BD_type:edu|display=title}}[[Category:2010 establishments in Bangladesh]][[Category:Educational institutions established in 2010]][[Category:Jhenaidah District]][[Category:Public universities of Bangladesh]])

(0	Draft:Pravin Daryani	{{AFC submission|d|bio|u=Dasachin|ns=118|decliner=My name is not dave|declinets=20171230174814|ts=20171108094337}} <!-- Do not remove this line! -->{{AFC comment|1=Most of the sources are the same press release repeated in multiple websites. Others are an interview (not appropriate for establishing notability as it is not an independent source) and articles that merely namecheck Mr. Daryani. [[User talk:My name is not dave|<span style="color:#000000">'''''!'''''</span><span style="color:#F00">'''dave'''</span>]] 17:48, 30 December 2017 (UTC)}}----{{Infobox person| name = Pravin Daryani| image = Pravin_Daryani.jpg| birth_date = 26, Feb 1986}}'''Pravin P. Daryani''' (born 27 February, 1986) is an Indian business coach and entrepreneur.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url=http://www.merinews.com/article/pravin-daryani---the-growth-of-msmes-will-decide-the-future-of-india-inc/15927557.shtml|title=Pravin Daryani - the growth of MSMEs will decide the future of India Inc|website=www.merinews.com|access-date=2017-11-08}}</ref> He is a consultant to small and medium entrepreneurs in India.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://knnindia.co.in/news/newsdetails/msme/iild-sets-up-msme-training-centre-in-hyderabad|title=IILD sets up MSME training centre in Hyderabad|last=KNN|first=DA|date=13 October 2017|work=KNN India|access-date=13 October 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> He has trained over 16,500 individuals including 8,500 entrepreneurs, primarily focusing on Micro, Small and Medium entrepreneurs in India.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://indiaeducationdiary.in/todays-msmes-tomorrows-mncs/|title=Today's MSMEs are tomorrow’s MNCs - India Education Diary|last=Admin|first=India Education Diary Bureau|date=2017-11-06|work=India Education Diary|access-date=2017-11-08|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://smepost.com/news/250-msme-businessmen-graduate-from-iilds-flagship-training-programme-speed/26405|title=250 MSME businessmen graduate from IILD’s flagship training programme ‘SPEED’|date=2017-09-19|work=SMEpost|access-date=2017-11-08|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref name=":2" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.myindiamyglory.com/2017/10/13/pravin-daryani-msme-growth-india/|title=Pravin Daryani - The growth of MSMEs will decide the future of India Inc.|date=2017-10-13|work=myIndiamyGlory|access-date=2017-11-08|language=en-GB}}</ref>== Early life and education ==Daryani was born to Prakash Daryani and Naina Daryani in [[Ulhasnagar]], a town located in the [[Thane]] district of [[Maharashtra, India]].<ref name="auto"/>He completed his Master’s in Business Management from Mumbai University before taking up a series of jobs. He eventually started his own training business, designing and conducting trainings for Small and Medium Entrepreneurs.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.businesstoday.in/prnewswire/index.jsp?rkey=20170919enIN201709184901_indiapublic&filter=2418|title=PR Newswire|website=www.businesstoday.in|access-date=2017-11-08}}</ref> This business was later formed into a company registered as [[Indian Institute of Learning and Development]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraphindia.com/pressrelease/prnw/63438/250-msme-businessmen-graduate-from-iild-s-speed-training-pro.html|title=250 MSME Businessmen Graduate From IILD's SPEED+ Training Pr|access-date=2017-11-08|language=en}}</ref>== References ==<!-- Inline citations added to your article will automatically display here. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WP:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. -->{{reflist}})
(0	Draft:Beestiality	{{AFC submission|d|dict|u=Beesiality|ns=118|decliner=Robert McClenon|declinets=20171227043541|ts=20171227032713}} <!-- Do not remove this line! -->{{AFC comment|1=Also, this appears to have been made up by the author, and would be a candidate for [[WP:A11]] in article space. [[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 04:35, 27 December 2017 (UTC)}}----<!-- EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->Beestiality - The love/affection for any species of bumble bees.This absurd affection can be acquired from sniffing pollen glue, an extreme high dose of bee poison mixed with honey, and or being completely stupid and trying to be like the lady from the "Bee Movie".== Beestality ==)
